newsitem.title: USA: IMF approves $486 mln 3-year credit for Croatia.
newsitem.headline: IMF approves $486 mln 3-year credit for Croatia.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund said on Thursday it approved a three-year, $486 million loan for Croatia to support the nation's economic reform plan.
The plan, which covers the period 1997 to 1999, aims to cement progress made in stabilizing the economy and help the country rebuild after the war.
"As prospects for regional peace have improved, there have also been mounting pressures resulting from expectations of higher living standards and social benefits," the IMF said.

It said that the Croatian government needed to balance the competing demands and maintain what it called a "prudent" stance. Although Croatia's large trade deficit has been cut, it has not been eliminated and is a "continuous challenge."
Some $158 million of the three-year IMF credit will be available to Croatia this year, the Fund added.
